Annotation.note:
Theorem about the Brocard points: Let $\Delta\,ABC$ be a triangle. The circles $c_1$ through $A,B$ and tangent to $g(AC)$, $c_2$ through $B,C$ and tangent to $g(AB)$, and $c_3$ through $A,C$ and tangent to $g(BC)$ pass through a common point.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
